contributors: ʻAbd al-Razzāq Kamāl al-Dīn ibn Isḥāq al-Samarqandī, 1413-1482.
item.title: Maṭlaʻ al-saʻdayn.
notes: Also available in digital form on the Library of Congress Web site.
Paper; cream-colored with no visible markings; rubrication; some worm damage in margins with no loss of text.
Browne, E. G. Literary history of Persia, v. 3, p. 428-430
Nastaʻliq; 19 lines in written area 23.5 x 12.5 cm
Also available in digital form on the Library of Congress website.
summary: The first volume of a two volume work which in all covers 170 years. The first volume covers the years from the birth of the last Mongol ruler of Persia Abū Saʻīd (704/1304/5) until the death of Abū S aʻīd, the granson of Tīmūr (807/1405).
medium: 331 leaves (19 lines) bound : paper ; 30.7 x 20.5 cm
other_title: Matla-us sudain : history of the period from 704 A.H. to 874 A.H. Starting from the birth of Sultan Abu Saeed Khan and others describing the empires of Iran and Turan

contributor: ʻabd al-razzāq kamāl al-dīn ibn isḥāq al-samarqandī
